Posts.Content: Thanks to the forum, I am well educated and trying to stay ahead of this battle. My father age 65 (lives in India) was diagnosed stage IV prostate cancer in 2010 with bone and liver mets. Since then he had a surgery (sub capsular orchiectomy in 2010) and 3 different chemo treatments. His latest chemo was 18 weekly sections. Thus far he completed 13 of 18 and the latest PSA was 6.2 (Aug 2012). The bone mets were stable from last scanning in Mar 2010. In between chemos he was on Estramustine and Nizoral - Ketoconazole. These worked only for short time. I realize in near future he needs other alternatives like Zytiga and MDV3100. Zytiga is very expensive for me to order from online Canadian pharmacies. MDV3100 is yet to be released into market. I called J&J Patient Assistance Program if the program is available in India and the answer is NO. As per J&J, "The patient has to be in US and under doctor supervision." I am willing to pay modest amount. Stealing is not an option unless it will completely cure him. Thank you for reading the post and comments.
Posts.Signature: ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Dx June 2010 PSA 166 @ age 63 Gleason 3+4, METS in Bones and Liver subcapsular orchiectomy on 10 July 2010 PSA on 24 Aug 2010 - 66 PSA on 25 Sep 2010 - 25 Received 4 different Chemos since Nov 2010. Most recent one in Feb-Mar 2013 failed. PSA on 25 Mar 2013 - >1000
Posts.Title: How can I get Zytiga and MDV3100 at low cost in non US countries? say India

Posts.Content: As of now, my father completed Cycle 5, Day 15 Chemo on Mitoxantrone. He is also on monthly Bisphosphonate for bones. I spent 2 weeks with him recently in India. He is good spirits and appreciates life. His Oncologist said Jevetna is available in India but v..very expensive. As of now Zytiga is still not available there. I asked him if there are any generics, his answer was no and it could take years for the patent to expire and generic version available in market. I don't know how long this will last. Preparing for the worse.

Posts.Content: Hi, Don't give up. I have the same problem with my father. His PSA went from 6 to 80 in last 4 months. If you are in US call the Zytiga and talk with the doctor. When I called Zytiga for help they said, my father needs to be in US under doctor guidance for help. In my case unfortunately he wasn't.
